command.framework

Interface Outputter

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ConsoleOutputter, Wrapper

    public interface Outputter
    This interface needs to be implemented by a class that outputs the passed strings to either a console, a TCP/IP-Port, to a file, etc. Currently, output to a console is supported only. This interface is used to inverse the dependency from invoker to commands. With this interface, the commands do not need to know a particular invoker to output strings.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void newline()
      Outputs a newline.
      void print(String text)
      Outputs the string.
      void printLn(String line)
      Outputs the string and adds a newline at the end.
      char readSingleCharacter()
      Reads a single character from the channel May be used to ask the user Yes/No questions.

    • Method Detail

      • printLn

        void printLn(String line)
        Outputs the string and adds a newline at the end. If a newline is already passed, two newlines are output.
        Parameters:
        line - string to output. No ending newline character required.

      • print

        void print(String text)
        Outputs the string. Does not add a newline at the end.
        Parameters:
        text - string to output.

      • newline

        void newline()
        Outputs a newline.

      • readSingleCharacter

        char readSingleCharacter()
        Reads a single character from the channel May be used to ask the user Yes/No questions.
        Note: This function does not return until user entered a character. It may be that calling this function causes a deadlock!
        Usage:
            outputter.printLn("Overwrite (Yes/No/All)?:");
            char in = outputter.readSingleCharacter();
            if (in != 'y' && in != 'Y') {
               return;
            }
        Returns:
        character read
